tags: had to rewrite so much of this
summary: Something Borrowed - Chapter 34 - ThisCat - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
title: Something Borrowed - Chapter 34 - ThisCat - 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Updaaate

Izuku doesn’t join in the halftime activities.

It takes him a while to calm down from the rush of the cavalry battle. He never expected to get all the way to the final tournament. To be perfectly honest, he never wanted to. There are others who wanted it so much more, and he was planning to let them have it, but then it wasn’t all about him anymore. It was about Uraraka, and Tsuyu, and Hatsume too, and he might have gone a little too far.

Tsuyu called it a quirk rampage. In hindsight, it’s a fitting name.

He can admit that it wasn’t all luck this time. He had so many quirks to pick and choose from, and it worked. It worked far better than he thought it would.

The worst part is that he wants to do it again.

blog.name: tobobio
blog.title: Bakubros
blog.description: i write Bakugou x reader scenarios. Ask box: CLOSED I try to post everyday. Art blog: momobuta

summary: His Tyranny [Bakugou x Reader Fantasy AU] Pt. 3
title: His Tyranny [Bakugou x Reader Fantasy AU] Pt. 3
body:
You were awoken the next morning when a knock on the door echoed through your room, and the soft muffle of a familiar voice heard through the wall.

“(y/n), wake up and come eat breakfast” he called. You got up, opening the door still in your groggy state and greeting your newfound friend, following him down to the dining room. You were dressed in the white night gown he had provided you last night in place of your torn dress.

And of course, the blonde male was already down there, devouring his plate. The atmosphere tense, and not daring to speak a word. Both choosing to ignore one another, you grabbed your own plate of food and sat next to your friend.

You opted to engage into small conversation with Bernard, not even batting an eyelash to the ash blonde. Seeing you carrying on such a carefree attitude, despite yesterday’s events, seemed to fuel the male making his blood boil. How could you just ignore him? You were just a shitty brat? How did you even manage to be speaking so calmly? And to a peasant what more?

Was he jealous?

“Hey brat” he called, but you went on with your conversation with your friend uninterrupted.

An irk mark surfaced his skin knowing you were purposefully ignoring him. “Oi, princess I know you heard me.”

You side eyed him giving him a quick glance then turning your attention back to Bernard. Oh we were gonna be petty huh? Well we can be petty. We can fucking be petty.

“Well since you’re not answering me I guess that means I’ll be going outside by myself today…” he sighs, doing his best to keep a smirk from showing on his face. Leaning his head on the palm of hand and resting his elbow on top of the table, keeping his face bored and uninterested. “I was gonna fly by the Suijin Kingdom, they’re pretty close to the ocean. Heard the water there is so clear you couldn’t even tell if there was water there, maybe I’ll even go for a little dip myself…”

Your ears perked up at his words, but you stay defiant and held your ground.

You heard the scraping of the chair against the wooden floor as Bakugou got up from his seat, and turning towards the door. You swallowed the lump in your throat as you pondered at the thought of the ocean. When had been the last time you had gone to the beach or even seen one? Being able to feel the cool ocean waves hit your legs, and feel the sand digging in between your toes just sounded so… enticing….

“Wait.”

Gotcha.

“You’re taking me with you…I…”

Now looking at you from the corner of his eye, that smirk he was hiding now stretched across his face. “I want to see the ocean.”

Turning back around, crimson irises now making eye contact with your (e/c) ones. His shit eating smirk now in full display.

“Then let’s get a move on princess.”

~

You dressed back into your torn dress. Internally cursing to yourself for not even considering packing at least some extra clothes from home. Well it hadn’t been all that bad, with the breeze seeping through the manmade entrance and running up your exposed calves. Everything important was in tact and covered up, you could be thankful for that in the least.

The flight wasn’t too bad. Your stomach flipped occasionally due to still not being used to flying, but you were able to hold back any of your breakfast from coming back up. Luckily you weren’t in the sky for too long, Bakugou informing you that they were going to make a pit stop in a city in Suijin Kingdom.

You landed in front of a tall gate, which granted access to the city that was secured within the connecting walls of the gate. A group of knights guarded the front, one stepping forward towards the three of you.

“State your name and purpose.”

“It’s me you asshat, just let me in!” Bakugou growls, wearing an annoyed scowl. Behind him you were still cautiously getting down from the beast’s neck before you could join the male.

The man sighs, looking back at the knights that stood at the gate.

“King Bakugou, we’ve told you many times to stop coming here. You know you’re banned from this city.”

“I don’t give a shit! Outta my way!!” he shoves the knight to the side, forcefully making his way towards the entrance. Before he could reach the door his path is blocked by swords crossed against each other in an x. “King Bakugou, we will not tell you twice. You are restricted from entering this city. Now please leave before we take further action.”

He clicks his tongue. His hand gripping at the handle of his sword preparing for a fight, but pauses when your voice calls him from behind. “Hey king could you hurry it up and let us in, I really gotta pee!” waving a hand in the air, the other one cupping at the side of your mouth.

Glaring back over his shoulder at you, a confused expression on your features completely oblivious of the situation. He grudgingly walks back to you, and yanking at your elbow. “C’mon they won’t open the damn gate so we’ll just have to enter our way.”

“Huh?”

Next thing you knew you were thrown back onto the dragon, not even getting the chance to properly seat yourself as the beast takes flight once again. Your body sprawled sideways on the dragon’s neck, desperately clinging for dear life in the uncomfortable position. “H-hey! I’m gonna die!!!” your legs swinging freely and your grip just about to slip.

With one strong motion of his neck, you slip off the beasts neck and you free fall for a few seconds until your bottom hits the ground hard. The fall was a good 5 ft to the rough gravel, but it still hurt like hell. “At least let me settle down before you take off!” you snap at the male, but he ignores your nagging and sets off on his own.

You catch up to the blonde, trailing close to this back to avoid getting lost as you venture deeper into a bustling city. People crowded the streets, children running around, horses pulling carts, merchants selling products, mothers gossiping about juicy rumors. It was all another new setting to you. You were lost in the noise with curiosity painted on every inch of your face.  

As you were too busy gazing and questioning everything you saw, you hadn’t noticed Bakugou had stopped walking and you directly run into his back.

“Wha-”

“Watch where you’re going dumbass! I’m gonna talk to this merchant, so don’t get lost and wait here like a good girl.” motioning a thumb to the store you had stopped in front of. You click your tongue in response and mumble something incoherent under your breath, but you oblige nonetheless and seat yourself on top of a nearby crate.

You mindlessly swing your legs and whistle to yourself to pass the time, staring up at the clear blue sky above. When you felt the eyes of strangers burning into you.

“That girl’s dress is torn, her legs are completely exposed how distasteful.”

“She must be a vagrant.”

“I have never seen such poor etiquette from a young lady, someone should at least teach her some sense.”

“I saw that girl walking along side that barbaric king of Kojin. She must be his new mistress.”

“King of Kojin is here? Who in their right mind would ever let themselves be courted by that horrible man. That girl is asking for her death wish.”

Your eye twitched at the judgmental comments. ‘Jeez people here really don’t know how to mind their business and keep their mouth shut huh.’ looking down at your torn dress. The (s/c) of your legs completely exposed, and you couldn’t deny that wearing such a raggedy dress did make you look like some kind of dirty tramp. Everyone else in the city had been dressed in neat gowns with shining brooches adorning their necks, making them seem more than well off. Not one person looked less than a commoner. Or even of a commoner.

Bakugou steps out of the shop, walking back over to you.

“Hey king.” pulling yourself out of your thoughts, he narrows his eyes down at you.

“Buy me new clothes.”

“Ha?!” his mouth hangs open in annoyance. Pulling at the torn area of your dress, fumbling awkwardly with the loose threads that bunched together. “I didn’t bring any other clothes with me. And as you can see,” wiggling your legs in the air, “My dress is torn, and my legs get awfully cold.”

“No way go buy your own damn clothes princess.”

You scowl, jutting your lips out in a pout. “But you’re the one who did this! So expiate! Besides… I don’t have money… ” Bakugou just groans, rubbing his face in his hand. “Fine fine! What fucking ever! Just make it quick!”

~

“How bout this one? Oh! Oh! Or this one!”

You plucked at multiple dresses, each with different designs and colors. Some with frills, others adorned with satin bows or fancy jewels. There was just so many to choose from.

“I’m gonna go try these on!” you exclaimed dragging an armful of gowns into the changing room. Bakugou sat with his head in his hands, internally screaming that he was dragged into this episode of ‘Say Yes to the Dress’

“Why the fuck did I even comply” he groans. The sound of curtain being swung open, and you stepped out. You were wearing a long-sleeve red gown that nicely complimented your skin color. The neckline was an off the shoulder design, maturely exposing your neck and collarbones, with the hem decorated with lace and pearls. There was a black satin ribbon tied around your midriff that cinched your waist, accentuating your curves. And the skirt fell down to just an inch above the ground, with frills falling in the front.

You twirled around the store, modeling in front of the ash blonde male. “So how does it look? The color is really nice dontcha think? It’s my favorite out of all of them.” you smile at him, as you rub at the soft fabric of the gown.

Bakugou just stares at you. His face unusually calm, but his brows furrowed in a focus on your form. He silently gets up walking to the counter and throwing money in front of the store keeper, causing them to jump. “I’m taking that dress.” pointing a finger to you.

“Eh?!”

Turning back to look at you, you tilt your head in confusion. He sighs, “And whatever other dresses that idiot over there wants.” and he walks out the store leaving both you and the storekeeper abruptly and utterly lost.

Outside, Bakugou makes his way to a dark empty alleyway. Leaning against the cool brick wall and raising a hand to his slowly heating face. ‘Idiot…’

~

After your little shopping spree, the two of you headed back to the dragon who was resting under a patch of shade underneath some trees.

“C’mon bud, we’re heading east” Bakugou says as he pats the snout of the red beast, rising to his wake. “Wow you’re so much nicer to your dragons than any other human.” you snicker. “Shut it princess before I leave you behind.”

“Yeah yeah” you roll your eyes.

You watched from above as the light beige of sand came into sight, and very soon the crystal blue water of the ocean. You squealed in excitement, excitedly shaking Bakugou’s shoulders. “Look! Look! It’s the sea! It’s the sea!”

“Yes I know I can see it idiot!” he barked back, “Quit shaking me!”

The dragon eased down onto the sand, much softer this time to avoid the grainy particles from flying around. You couldn’t hold your extreme thrill as you threw yourself off it’s neck and dart towards the shore. Hurriedly kicking off your boots and pulling up the skirt of your dress, and you anticipated the cool waves hitting your skin.

The water was so cold and refreshing, and the wet sand in between your toes was like a soft cushion that sunk you into the earth. You were in bliss.

“Oi princess be careful! I just bought that fucking dress you’re going to ruin it!” he yelled from behind you, though you ignored his angry scolding and continued admiring the transparency of the water and spotting the small wildlife inhabiting below the surface.

“Hey hey! There’s little fish here!”

“Hey! Don’t ignore me idiot!”

You turn over your shoulder giving him an angry pout, “Loosen up a bit would ya? We’re at the beach!” he steps closer to you, stopping just before where the incoming waves could reach him. “Tch, we’re only here because it was my bait into getting you to come with me.”

“Well whatever” you bend down, attempting to chase one of the fish with your hands, causing the bottom of your gown to dip into the water.

“Oi! What the fuck did I just say! Don’t you ever listen!?” he runs to your back, lifting up your skirt on each side, just enough to hover above the water. “You’re one big fucking airhead of a princess!”

You quickly straightened your back back up and glaring at the male behind you. “I am not! And I am not a princess! Quit calling me that!” you swiftly scoop up a handful of water and throw it at him, “Take that idiot king!”

He steps back, blocking your attack with an arm. “Cut that out idiot!” you just laugh sending splashes of water his way in a barrage of waves. “Fine then. You asked for it princess.” and thus you spent the rest of your afternoon having a salty water war and scavenging through tide pools for little treasures. Most of the time Bakugou screaming at you and you running off too happy without a care in the world.

After your little fun was over, the two took shelter under the wing of his dragon, resting against the smooth scales of the beast, watching the sun slowly start to set.

“That was fun. I totally kicked your butt.” you chuckled to yourself. Bakugou gave you a disagreeing look and scoffed, “Yeah right. As if you could ever beat me princess, I’m a fucking warlord.” you roll your eyes at his narcissistic response. “Man would you quit with that?”

He shrugs, “it’s true, I’m the best fucking fighter there is, no one-”

“Not that.”

Raising a brow at you in confusion. “You haven’t even bothered to learn my name, all you do is call me princess. I already told you I’m not a princess. Far from it.”

You sigh, staring at the orange hues that warmed up the sky. “(y/n). (l/n)(y/n)” tilting your head to the ash blonde. “That’s my name.” a small smirk pulls his lips, “Alright (y/n). Then you can refer to me as ‘my lord’ hmm, or ‘your majesty’. Your pick”

You lightly punch his shoulder, “Jeez what is wrong with you” he snickers, your gaze going back to the sky laying there in silence for a bit.

“Katsuki.” his voice low, almost a whisper.

“Katsuki?”

“My name. Bakugou Katsuki.”

Your eyes widen and your irises glow in amusement. You nod happily. Finally some progress.

“Ok Katsuki!”

Maybe staying here wouldn’t be all that bad.

reblog.comment:
You were awoken the next morning when a knock on the door echoed through your room, and the soft muffle of a familiar voice heard through the wall.

“(y/n), wake up and come eat breakfast” he called. You got up, opening the door still in your groggy state and greeting your newfound friend, following him down to the dining room. You were dressed in the white night gown he had provided you last night in place of your torn dress.

And of course, the blonde male was already down there, devouring his plate. The atmosphere tense, and not daring to speak a word. Both choosing to ignore one another, you grabbed your own plate of food and sat next to your friend.

You opted to engage into small conversation with Bernard, not even batting an eyelash to the ash blonde. Seeing you carrying on such a carefree attitude, despite yesterday’s events, seemed to fuel the male making his blood boil. How could you just ignore him? You were just a shitty brat? How did you even manage to be speaking so calmly? And to a peasant what more?

Was he jealous?

“Hey brat” he called, but you went on with your conversation with your friend uninterrupted.

An irk mark surfaced his skin knowing you were purposefully ignoring him. “Oi, princess I know you heard me.”

You side eyed him giving him a quick glance then turning your attention back to Bernard. Oh we were gonna be petty huh? Well we can be petty. We can fucking be petty.

“Well since you’re not answering me I guess that means I’ll be going outside by myself today…” he sighs, doing his best to keep a smirk from showing on his face. Leaning his head on the palm of hand and resting his elbow on top of the table, keeping his face bored and uninterested. “I was gonna fly by the Suijin Kingdom, they’re pretty close to the ocean. Heard the water there is so clear you couldn’t even tell if there was water there, maybe I’ll even go for a little dip myself…”

Your ears perked up at his words, but you stay defiant and held your ground.

You heard the scraping of the chair against the wooden floor as Bakugou got up from his seat, and turning towards the door. You swallowed the lump in your throat as you pondered at the thought of the ocean. When had been the last time you had gone to the beach or even seen one? Being able to feel the cool ocean waves hit your legs, and feel the sand digging in between your toes just sounded so… enticing….

“Wait.”

Gotcha.

“You’re taking me with you…I…”

Now looking at you from the corner of his eye, that smirk he was hiding now stretched across his face. “I want to see the ocean.”

Turning back around, crimson irises now making eye contact with your (e/c) ones. His shit eating smirk now in full display.

“Then let’s get a move on princess.”

~

You dressed back into your torn dress. Internally cursing to yourself for not even considering packing at least some extra clothes from home. Well it hadn’t been all that bad, with the breeze seeping through the manmade entrance and running up your exposed calves. Everything important was in tact and covered up, you could be thankful for that in the least.

The flight wasn’t too bad. Your stomach flipped occasionally due to still not being used to flying, but you were able to hold back any of your breakfast from coming back up. Luckily you weren’t in the sky for too long, Bakugou informing you that they were going to make a pit stop in a city in Suijin Kingdom.

You landed in front of a tall gate, which granted access to the city that was secured within the connecting walls of the gate. A group of knights guarded the front, one stepping forward towards the three of you.

“State your name and purpose.”

“It’s me you asshat, just let me in!” Bakugou growls, wearing an annoyed scowl. Behind him you were still cautiously getting down from the beast’s neck before you could join the male.

The man sighs, looking back at the knights that stood at the gate.

“King Bakugou, we’ve told you many times to stop coming here. You know you’re banned from this city.”

“I don’t give a shit! Outta my way!!” he shoves the knight to the side, forcefully making his way towards the entrance. Before he could reach the door his path is blocked by swords crossed against each other in an x. “King Bakugou, we will not tell you twice. You are restricted from entering this city. Now please leave before we take further action.”

He clicks his tongue. His hand gripping at the handle of his sword preparing for a fight, but pauses when your voice calls him from behind. “Hey king could you hurry it up and let us in, I really gotta pee!” waving a hand in the air, the other one cupping at the side of your mouth.

Glaring back over his shoulder at you, a confused expression on your features completely oblivious of the situation. He grudgingly walks back to you, and yanking at your elbow. “C’mon they won’t open the damn gate so we’ll just have to enter our way.”

“Huh?”

Next thing you knew you were thrown back onto the dragon, not even getting the chance to properly seat yourself as the beast takes flight once again. Your body sprawled sideways on the dragon’s neck, desperately clinging for dear life in the uncomfortable position. “H-hey! I’m gonna die!!!” your legs swinging freely and your grip just about to slip.

With one strong motion of his neck, you slip off the beasts neck and you free fall for a few seconds until your bottom hits the ground hard. The fall was a good 5 ft to the rough gravel, but it still hurt like hell. “At least let me settle down before you take off!” you snap at the male, but he ignores your nagging and sets off on his own.

You catch up to the blonde, trailing close to this back to avoid getting lost as you venture deeper into a bustling city. People crowded the streets, children running around, horses pulling carts, merchants selling products, mothers gossiping about juicy rumors. It was all another new setting to you. You were lost in the noise with curiosity painted on every inch of your face.  

As you were too busy gazing and questioning everything you saw, you hadn’t noticed Bakugou had stopped walking and you directly run into his back.

“Wha-”

“Watch where you’re going dumbass! I’m gonna talk to this merchant, so don’t get lost and wait here like a good girl.” motioning a thumb to the store you had stopped in front of. You click your tongue in response and mumble something incoherent under your breath, but you oblige nonetheless and seat yourself on top of a nearby crate.

You mindlessly swing your legs and whistle to yourself to pass the time, staring up at the clear blue sky above. When you felt the eyes of strangers burning into you.

“That girl’s dress is torn, her legs are completely exposed how distasteful.”

“She must be a vagrant.”

“I have never seen such poor etiquette from a young lady, someone should at least teach her some sense.”

“I saw that girl walking along side that barbaric king of Kojin. She must be his new mistress.”

“King of Kojin is here? Who in their right mind would ever let themselves be courted by that horrible man. That girl is asking for her death wish.”

Your eye twitched at the judgmental comments. ‘Jeez people here really don’t know how to mind their business and keep their mouth shut huh.’ looking down at your torn dress. The (s/c) of your legs completely exposed, and you couldn’t deny that wearing such a raggedy dress did make you look like some kind of dirty tramp. Everyone else in the city had been dressed in neat gowns with shining brooches adorning their necks, making them seem more than well off. Not one person looked less than a commoner. Or even of a commoner.

Bakugou steps out of the shop, walking back over to you.

“Hey king.” pulling yourself out of your thoughts, he narrows his eyes down at you.

“Buy me new clothes.”

“Ha?!” his mouth hangs open in annoyance. Pulling at the torn area of your dress, fumbling awkwardly with the loose threads that bunched together. “I didn’t bring any other clothes with me. And as you can see,” wiggling your legs in the air, “My dress is torn, and my legs get awfully cold.”

“No way go buy your own damn clothes princess.”

You scowl, jutting your lips out in a pout. “But you’re the one who did this! So expiate! Besides… I don’t have money… ” Bakugou just groans, rubbing his face in his hand. “Fine fine! What fucking ever! Just make it quick!”

~

“How bout this one? Oh! Oh! Or this one!”

You plucked at multiple dresses, each with different designs and colors. Some with frills, others adorned with satin bows or fancy jewels. There was just so many to choose from.

“I’m gonna go try these on!” you exclaimed dragging an armful of gowns into the changing room. Bakugou sat with his head in his hands, internally screaming that he was dragged into this episode of ‘Say Yes to the Dress’

“Why the fuck did I even comply” he groans. The sound of curtain being swung open, and you stepped out. You were wearing a long-sleeve red gown that nicely complimented your skin color. The neckline was an off the shoulder design, maturely exposing your neck and collarbones, with the hem decorated with lace and pearls. There was a black satin ribbon tied around your midriff that cinched your waist, accentuating your curves. And the skirt fell down to just an inch above the ground, with frills falling in the front.

You twirled around the store, modeling in front of the ash blonde male. “So how does it look? The color is really nice dontcha think? It’s my favorite out of all of them.” you smile at him, as you rub at the soft fabric of the gown.

Bakugou just stares at you. His face unusually calm, but his brows furrowed in a focus on your form. He silently gets up walking to the counter and throwing money in front of the store keeper, causing them to jump. “I’m taking that dress.” pointing a finger to you.

“Eh?!”

Turning back to look at you, you tilt your head in confusion. He sighs, “And whatever other dresses that idiot over there wants.” and he walks out the store leaving both you and the storekeeper abruptly and utterly lost.

Outside, Bakugou makes his way to a dark empty alleyway. Leaning against the cool brick wall and raising a hand to his slowly heating face. ‘Idiot…’

~

After your little shopping spree, the two of you headed back to the dragon who was resting under a patch of shade underneath some trees.

“C’mon bud, we’re heading east” Bakugou says as he pats the snout of the red beast, rising to his wake. “Wow you’re so much nicer to your dragons than any other human.” you snicker. “Shut it princess before I leave you behind.”

“Yeah yeah” you roll your eyes.

You watched from above as the light beige of sand came into sight, and very soon the crystal blue water of the ocean. You squealed in excitement, excitedly shaking Bakugou’s shoulders. “Look! Look! It’s the sea! It’s the sea!”

“Yes I know I can see it idiot!” he barked back, “Quit shaking me!”

The dragon eased down onto the sand, much softer this time to avoid the grainy particles from flying around. You couldn’t hold your extreme thrill as you threw yourself off it’s neck and dart towards the shore. Hurriedly kicking off your boots and pulling up the skirt of your dress, and you anticipated the cool waves hitting your skin.

The water was so cold and refreshing, and the wet sand in between your toes was like a soft cushion that sunk you into the earth. You were in bliss.

“Oi princess be careful! I just bought that fucking dress you’re going to ruin it!” he yelled from behind you, though you ignored his angry scolding and continued admiring the transparency of the water and spotting the small wildlife inhabiting below the surface.

“Hey hey! There’s little fish here!”

“Hey! Don’t ignore me idiot!”

You turn over your shoulder giving him an angry pout, “Loosen up a bit would ya? We’re at the beach!” he steps closer to you, stopping just before where the incoming waves could reach him. “Tch, we’re only here because it was my bait into getting you to come with me.”

“Well whatever” you bend down, attempting to chase one of the fish with your hands, causing the bottom of your gown to dip into the water.

“Oi! What the fuck did I just say! Don’t you ever listen!?” he runs to your back, lifting up your skirt on each side, just enough to hover above the water. “You’re one big fucking airhead of a princess!”

You quickly straightened your back back up and glaring at the male behind you. “I am not! And I am not a princess! Quit calling me that!” you swiftly scoop up a handful of water and throw it at him, “Take that idiot king!”

He steps back, blocking your attack with an arm. “Cut that out idiot!” you just laugh sending splashes of water his way in a barrage of waves. “Fine then. You asked for it princess.” and thus you spent the rest of your afternoon having a salty water war and scavenging through tide pools for little treasures. Most of the time Bakugou screaming at you and you running off too happy without a care in the world.

After your little fun was over, the two took shelter under the wing of his dragon, resting against the smooth scales of the beast, watching the sun slowly start to set.

“That was fun. I totally kicked your butt.” you chuckled to yourself. Bakugou gave you a disagreeing look and scoffed, “Yeah right. As if you could ever beat me princess, I’m a fucking warlord.” you roll your eyes at his narcissistic response. “Man would you quit with that?”

He shrugs, “it’s true, I’m the best fucking fighter there is, no one-”

“Not that.”

Raising a brow at you in confusion. “You haven’t even bothered to learn my name, all you do is call me princess. I already told you I’m not a princess. Far from it.”

You sigh, staring at the orange hues that warmed up the sky. “(y/n). (l/n)(y/n)” tilting your head to the ash blonde. “That’s my name.” a small smirk pulls his lips, “Alright (y/n). Then you can refer to me as ‘my lord’ hmm, or ‘your majesty’. Your pick”

You lightly punch his shoulder, “Jeez what is wrong with you” he snickers, your gaze going back to the sky laying there in silence for a bit.

“Katsuki.” his voice low, almost a whisper.

“Katsuki?”

“My name. Bakugou Katsuki.”

Your eyes widen and your irises glow in amusement. You nod happily. Finally some progress.

“Ok Katsuki!”

Maybe staying here wouldn’t be all that bad.

“Well since you’re not answering me I guess that means I’ll be going outside by myself today…” he sighs, doing his best to keep a smirk from showing on his face. Leaning his head on the palm of hand and resting his elbow on top of the table, keeping his face bored and uninterested. “I was gonna fly by the Suijin Kingdom, they’re pretty close to the ocean. Heard the water there is so clear you couldn’t even tell if there was water there, maybe I’ll even go for a little dip myself…”

Your ears perked up at his words, but you stay defiant and held your ground.

You heard the scraping of the chair against the wooden floor as Bakugou got up from his seat, and turning towards the door. You swallowed the lump in your throat as you pondered at the thought of the ocean. When had been the last time you had gone to the beach or even seen one? Being able to feel the cool ocean waves hit your legs, and feel the sand digging in between your toes just sounded so… enticing….

“Wait.”

Gotcha.

“You’re taking me with you…I…”

Now looking at you from the corner of his eye, that smirk he was hiding now stretched across his face. “I want to see the ocean.”

Turning back around, crimson irises now making eye contact with your (e/c) ones. His shit eating smirk now in full display.

“Then let’s get a move on princess.”

~

You dressed back into your torn dress. Internally cursing to yourself for not even considering packing at least some extra clothes from home. Well it hadn’t been all that bad, with the breeze seeping through the manmade entrance and running up your exposed calves. Everything important was in tact and covered up, you could be thankful for that in the least.

The flight wasn’t too bad. Your stomach flipped occasionally due to still not being used to flying, but you were able to hold back any of your breakfast from coming back up. Luckily you weren’t in the sky for too long, Bakugou informing you that they were going to make a pit stop in a city in Suijin Kingdom.

You landed in front of a tall gate, which granted access to the city that was secured within the connecting walls of the gate. A group of knights guarded the front, one stepping forward towards the three of you.

“State your name and purpose.”

“It’s me you asshat, just let me in!” Bakugou growls, wearing an annoyed scowl. Behind him you were still cautiously getting down from the beast’s neck before you could join the male.

The man sighs, looking back at the knights that stood at the gate.

“King Bakugou, we’ve told you many times to stop coming here. You know you’re banned from this city.”

“I don’t give a shit! Outta my way!!” he shoves the knight to the side, forcefully making his way towards the entrance. Before he could reach the door his path is blocked by swords crossed against each other in an x. “King Bakugou, we will not tell you twice. You are restricted from entering this city. Now please leave before we take further action.”

He clicks his tongue. His hand gripping at the handle of his sword preparing for a fight, but pauses when your voice calls him from behind. “Hey king could you hurry it up and let us in, I really gotta pee!” waving a hand in the air, the other one cupping at the side of your mouth.

Glaring back over his shoulder at you, a confused expression on your features completely oblivious of the situation. He grudgingly walks back to you, and yanking at your elbow. “C’mon they won’t open the damn gate so we’ll just have to enter our way.”

“Huh?”

Next thing you knew you were thrown back onto the dragon, not even getting the chance to properly seat yourself as the beast takes flight once again. Your body sprawled sideways on the dragon’s neck, desperately clinging for dear life in the uncomfortable position. “H-hey! I’m gonna die!!!” your legs swinging freely and your grip just about to slip.

With one strong motion of his neck, you slip off the beasts neck and you free fall for a few seconds until your bottom hits the ground hard. The fall was a good 5 ft to the rough gravel, but it still hurt like hell. “At least let me settle down before you take off!” you snap at the male, but he ignores your nagging and sets off on his own.

You catch up to the blonde, trailing close to this back to avoid getting lost as you venture deeper into a bustling city. People crowded the streets, children running around, horses pulling carts, merchants selling products, mothers gossiping about juicy rumors. It was all another new setting to you. You were lost in the noise with curiosity painted on every inch of your face.  

As you were too busy gazing and questioning everything you saw, you hadn’t noticed Bakugou had stopped walking and you directly run into his back.

“Wha-”

“Watch where you’re going dumbass! I’m gonna talk to this merchant, so don’t get lost and wait here like a good girl.” motioning a thumb to the store you had stopped in front of. You click your tongue in response and mumble something incoherent under your breath, but you oblige nonetheless and seat yourself on top of a nearby crate.

You mindlessly swing your legs and whistle to yourself to pass the time, staring up at the clear blue sky above. When you felt the eyes of strangers burning into you.

“That girl’s dress is torn, her legs are completely exposed how distasteful.”

“She must be a vagrant.”

“I have never seen such poor etiquette from a young lady, someone should at least teach her some sense.”

“I saw that girl walking along side that barbaric king of Kojin. She must be his new mistress.”

“King of Kojin is here? Who in their right mind would ever let themselves be courted by that horrible man. That girl is asking for her death wish.”

Your eye twitched at the judgmental comments. ‘Jeez people here really don’t know how to mind their business and keep their mouth shut huh.’ looking down at your torn dress. The (s/c) of your legs completely exposed, and you couldn’t deny that wearing such a raggedy dress did make you look like some kind of dirty tramp. Everyone else in the city had been dressed in neat gowns with shining brooches adorning their necks, making them seem more than well off. Not one person looked less than a commoner. Or even of a commoner.

Bakugou steps out of the shop, walking back over to you.

“Hey king.” pulling yourself out of your thoughts, he narrows his eyes down at you.

“Buy me new clothes.”

“Ha?!” his mouth hangs open in annoyance. Pulling at the torn area of your dress, fumbling awkwardly with the loose threads that bunched together. “I didn’t bring any other clothes with me. And as you can see,” wiggling your legs in the air, “My dress is torn, and my legs get awfully cold.”

“No way go buy your own damn clothes princess.”

You scowl, jutting your lips out in a pout. “But you’re the one who did this! So expiate! Besides… I don’t have money… ” Bakugou just groans, rubbing his face in his hand. “Fine fine! What fucking ever! Just make it quick!”

~

“How bout this one? Oh! Oh! Or this one!”

You plucked at multiple dresses, each with different designs and colors. Some with frills, others adorned with satin bows or fancy jewels. There was just so many to choose from.

“I’m gonna go try these on!” you exclaimed dragging an armful of gowns into the changing room. Bakugou sat with his head in his hands, internally screaming that he was dragged into this episode of ‘Say Yes to the Dress’

“Why the fuck did I even comply” he groans. The sound of curtain being swung open, and you stepped out. You were wearing a long-sleeve red gown that nicely complimented your skin color. The neckline was an off the shoulder design, maturely exposing your neck and collarbones, with the hem decorated with lace and pearls. There was a black satin ribbon tied around your midriff that cinched your waist, accentuating your curves. And the skirt fell down to just an inch above the ground, with frills falling in the front.

You twirled around the store, modeling in front of the ash blonde male. “So how does it look? The color is really nice dontcha think? It’s my favorite out of all of them.” you smile at him, as you rub at the soft fabric of the gown.

Bakugou just stares at you. His face unusually calm, but his brows furrowed in a focus on your form. He silently gets up walking to the counter and throwing money in front of the store keeper, causing them to jump. “I’m taking that dress.” pointing a finger to you.

“Eh?!”

Turning back to look at you, you tilt your head in confusion. He sighs, “And whatever other dresses that idiot over there wants.” and he walks out the store leaving both you and the storekeeper abruptly and utterly lost.

Outside, Bakugou makes his way to a dark empty alleyway. Leaning against the cool brick wall and raising a hand to his slowly heating face. ‘Idiot…’

~

After your little shopping spree, the two of you headed back to the dragon who was resting under a patch of shade underneath some trees.

“C’mon bud, we’re heading east” Bakugou says as he pats the snout of the red beast, rising to his wake. “Wow you’re so much nicer to your dragons than any other human.” you snicker. “Shut it princess before I leave you behind.”

“Yeah yeah” you roll your eyes.

You watched from above as the light beige of sand came into sight, and very soon the crystal blue water of the ocean. You squealed in excitement, excitedly shaking Bakugou’s shoulders. “Look! Look! It’s the sea! It’s the sea!”

“Yes I know I can see it idiot!” he barked back, “Quit shaking me!”

The dragon eased down onto the sand, much softer this time to avoid the grainy particles from flying around. You couldn’t hold your extreme thrill as you threw yourself off it’s neck and dart towards the shore. Hurriedly kicking off your boots and pulling up the skirt of your dress, and you anticipated the cool waves hitting your skin.

The water was so cold and refreshing, and the wet sand in between your toes was like a soft cushion that sunk you into the earth. You were in bliss.

“Oi princess be careful! I just bought that fucking dress you’re going to ruin it!” he yelled from behind you, though you ignored his angry scolding and continued admiring the transparency of the water and spotting the small wildlife inhabiting below the surface.

“Hey hey! There’s little fish here!”

“Hey! Don’t ignore me idiot!”

You turn over your shoulder giving him an angry pout, “Loosen up a bit would ya? We’re at the beach!” he steps closer to you, stopping just before where the incoming waves could reach him. “Tch, we’re only here because it was my bait into getting you to come with me.”

“Well whatever” you bend down, attempting to chase one of the fish with your hands, causing the bottom of your gown to dip into the water.

“Oi! What the fuck did I just say! Don’t you ever listen!?” he runs to your back, lifting up your skirt on each side, just enough to hover above the water. “You’re one big fucking airhead of a princess!”

You quickly straightened your back back up and glaring at the male behind you. “I am not! And I am not a princess! Quit calling me that!” you swiftly scoop up a handful of water and throw it at him, “Take that idiot king!”

He steps back, blocking your attack with an arm. “Cut that out idiot!” you just laugh sending splashes of water his way in a barrage of waves. “Fine then. You asked for it princess.” and thus you spent the rest of your afternoon having a salty water war and scavenging through tide pools for little treasures. Most of the time Bakugou screaming at you and you running off too happy without a care in the world.

After your little fun was over, the two took shelter under the wing of his dragon, resting against the smooth scales of the beast, watching the sun slowly start to set.

“That was fun. I totally kicked your butt.” you chuckled to yourself. Bakugou gave you a disagreeing look and scoffed, “Yeah right. As if you could ever beat me princess, I’m a fucking warlord.” you roll your eyes at his narcissistic response. “Man would you quit with that?”

He shrugs, “it’s true, I’m the best fucking fighter there is, no one-”

“Not that.”

Raising a brow at you in confusion. “You haven’t even bothered to learn my name, all you do is call me princess. I already told you I’m not a princess. Far from it.”

You sigh, staring at the orange hues that warmed up the sky. “(y/n). (l/n)(y/n)” tilting your head to the ash blonde. “That’s my name.” a small smirk pulls his lips, “Alright (y/n). Then you can refer to me as ‘my lord’ hmm, or ‘your majesty’. Your pick”

You lightly punch his shoulder, “Jeez what is wrong with you” he snickers, your gaze going back to the sky laying there in silence for a bit.

“Katsuki.” his voice low, almost a whisper.

“Katsuki?”

“My name. Bakugou Katsuki.”

Your eyes widen and your irises glow in amusement. You nod happily. Finally some progress.

“Ok Katsuki!”

Maybe staying here wouldn’t be all that bad.

body:
Honestly… i love her… look at my precious OC….

“On Wednesdays we wear labcoats. And Tuesdays… Thursdays, Mondays, fridays… weekends…”

Silence for a breif moment….

“Thanksgiving… Christmas… Easter… St. Patrick’s day….”
